column1: The said principle was observed by Sharvananda J. in Ramalingam Vs. Thangarajah

column2: “He is not to decide any question of title or right to possession of the parties
to  the  land.  Evidence  bearing  on  title  can  be  considered  only  when  the
is  clearly  balanced  and  the  presumption  of
possession which flows from title may tilt the balance in favour of the owner

column1: and help in deciding the question of possession”
